Detailed Description

Definitions for CTK SPE thread macros and routines.

Define Documentation

#define CTK_SPE_DONT_START   0x10000

Flag for ctk_spe_thread_create. Specifies that the created SPE thread should not be started. If the flag is specified the caller should explicitly start the created thread by ctk_spe_thread_start.

#define CTK_SPE_USER_REGS   0x0002

Flag for ctk_spe_thread_create. (Borrowed from libspe spec.) Specifies that the SPE setup registers r3, r4, and r5 are initialized with the 48 bytes pointed to by argp.

Typedef Documentation

typedef ctk_spe_thread_body_t* ctk_spe_thread_t

SPE thread handle

Function Documentation

int ctk_spe_thread_create ( ctk_spe_thread_t *  thread,
ctk_spe_program_t *  program,
void *  argp,
void *  envp,
int  flags 
)

Creates a new SPE thread from the given SPE program handle and starts the thread with arguments argp (unless the caller specifies CTK_SPE_DONT_START flag.)

Parameters:
[out] thread - pointer to store the created SPE thread
[in] program - SPE program handle
[in] argp - Argument pointer for the SPE thread
[in] envp - pointer to environment specific data for the SPE thread
[in] flags - A bit-wise OR of modifiers that are applied when the new thread is created. 0 (no flag) or any combination of CTK_SPE_USER_REGS, CTK_SPE_CFG_SIGNOTIFY1_OR, CTK_SPE_CFG_SIGNOTIFY2_OR and CTK_SPE_DONT_START can be specified.
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS on success, ERRNO on failure.

static ctk_spe_context_t ctk_spe_thread_get_context ( ctk_spe_thread_t  thread  )  [inline, static]

Returns the SPE context associated to the given SPE thread

Parameters:
[in] thread - the SPE thread
Returns:
the SPE context

static int ctk_spe_thread_get_status ( ctk_spe_thread_t  spe  )  [inline, static]

Returns SPE status of the given SPE thread.

Parameters:
[in] spe - the SPE thread
Returns:
either one of CTK_SPE_STATUS_CREATED, CTK_SPE_STATUS_LOADED, CTK_SPE_STATUS_READY, CTK_SPE_STATUS_RUNNING, CTK_SPE_STATUS_STOPPED or CTK_SPE_STATUS_UNKNOWN.

static int ctk_spe_thread_map_ls ( ctk_spe_thread_t  spe,
ea_addr_t *  map_addr 
) [inline, static]

Maps the LS (local storage) to the EA addr and returns the mapped addr. (equivalent to ctk_spe_map_ls; provided for backward compat)

Deprecated:
Parameters:
[in] spe - the SPE thread whose LS is mapped
[out] map_addr - the mapped address
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS on success, ERRNO on failure.
See also:
ctk_spe_map_ls

static int ctk_spe_thread_map_signal1 ( ctk_spe_thread_t  spe,
ea_addr_t *  map_addr 
) [inline, static]

Maps the signal notification register 1 for the SPE specified by spe and returns the mapped addr. (equivalent to ctk_spe_map_signal2; provided for backward compat)

Note:
The address is not DMA aligned (mod 16 = 12).
Deprecated:
Parameters:
[in] spe - the SPE whose signal notification register is mapped
[out] map_addr - the mapped address
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS on success, ERRNO on failure.
See also:
ctk_spe_map_signal1

static int ctk_spe_thread_map_signal2 ( ctk_spe_thread_t  spe,
ea_addr_t *  map_addr 
) [inline, static]

Maps the signal notification register 2 for the SPE specified by spe and returns the mapped addr. (equivalent to ctk_spe_map_signal2; provided for backward compat)

Note:
The address is not DMA aligned (mod 16 = 12).
Parameters:
[in] spe - the SPE thread whose signal notification register is mapped
[out] map_addr - the mapped address
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS on success, ERRNO on failure.

int ctk_spe_thread_start ( ctk_spe_thread_t  thread  ) 

Starts the given SPE thread.

Parameters:
[in] thread - the SPE thread (must be created with CTK_SPE_DONT_START flag.)
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS on success, ERRNO on failure.

int ctk_spe_thread_terminate ( ctk_spe_thread_t  thread  ) 

Terminates the given SPE thread and frees the resources.

Note:
This may not actually stop the SPE execution until it voluntarily releases the physical SPE. !!!Do not cleanup PPE resources while there could be any DMA or synchronization activities!!!
Deprecated:
Parameters:
[in] thread - the SPE thread
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS on success, ERRNO on failure.

int ctk_spe_thread_wait ( ctk_spe_thread_t  thread,
int *  status 
)

Waits until the given SPE thread exits and frees the resources.

Parameters:
[in] thread - the SPE thread
[out] status - the SPE exit status. The return code of the SPE thread can be obtained by a macro CTK_SPE_EXIT_STATUS(status) only if CTK_SPE_IF_EXITED(status) returns true.
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS on success, ERRNO on failure.
